span.span: Atlanta ISD is keeping track of the recent outbreak of Coronavirus in the United States through proven and trustworthy sources: The Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS), and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

Updated information from the CDC on coronavrius in the United States can be found at: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html. The most recent information about coronavirus in Texas may be found at: https://www.dshs.state.tx.us/coronavirus/
April 17, 2020 – Schools closed for remaining of school year
– District closed thru May 1
March 20, 2020 – Meal delivery and packet pickup information
March 19, 2020 – Governor closes Texas schools until April 3
March 18, 2020 – District closed
March 31
March 17, 2020 – AISD staff developing learning activities
March 16, 2020 – Meal plan distribution
March 14, 2020 – District closing March 16-20
March 13, 2020 – Campus sanitized during spring break
March 3, 2020 – Prevention of coronavirus
Free healthy and delicious meals will be available to all children ages 18 years and younger at the seven distribution sites below.

In order to feed as many students as possible, beginning Monday, March 23, 2020, Atlanta ISD will begin DELIVERING meals on four out of town bus routes including Marietta, Bivins, Smyrna, and O’ Farrell. We will also run an in town route to highly populated areas. The meals will be delivered between 11:00am -12:30pm. Since these areas are so large, it is hard to predict what time deliveries will be made so please be watching for an Atlanta ISD suburban or school bus. They will honk as they arrive.
If you live in an area not mentioned above and need meal delivery, please call the Atlanta administration office at (903) 796-4194.

You may continue to pick up a meal at any of the seven serving sites. The Texas Department of Agriculture requires each child 18 and younger to be present to receive a cafeteria meal. The parent does not need to be present. Students can come with any adult.
Meal Distribution Sites
Cass County Cowboy Church 7701 US-59, Atlanta, TX 75551
Victory Baptist Church 1405 Co Rd 3432, Atlanta, TX 75551
Douglasville Fire Department TX-77, Douglassville, TX 75560
Huffines Community Center 6487 FM 251, Bivins, TX 75555
Atlanta Elementary School 902 ABC Ln, Atlanta, TX 75551
Atlanta Middle School 600 High School Ln, Atlanta, TX 75551
Smyrna Baptist Church 4621 TX-77, Atlanta, TX 75551

span.span: Enrichment Resources – for students and parents
Chromebook Troubleshooting – Instructions for students
APS & AES – Next packet pickup is Monday, April 20.

AMS – All packets are due back April 20, 2020. You can pick up a new packet on that day as well. Please email any teacher or administrator with any problems you may be having, or if you have any questions.
AHS – All assignments should be submitted through google classroom- please email teachers with any questions.

Walmart parking lot – 201 US-59
